Win streak = trait?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Win streak = trait?
By Skysrpke on Wednesday, May 5, 2010 - 07:39 pm:

ok i'm not new to mra2 at all i have played mra as well anyway i have a psirow zuum that is only A- rank because i have trianed him to much and he has the trait dignity. It has never lost a single fight period. here are it's stats

Name Psi
pass b11

pow 521
int 53
acc 387
spd 391
def 458
lif 370

Traits
up tail
up earth
success
up mind
popular
dignity

popularity 100

75 wins 0 loss
I'm going to turn him into a coach,Does anyone agree that a long win streak may help u get the trait dignity?

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, May 6, 2010 - 06:55 pm:

I'm sorry, I wish I remembered more about this game. I'm posting mainly in hopes that someone sees this message on 'Last Day' and responds.

By Infernus on Thursday, May 6, 2010 - 08:19 pm:

It definitely sounds feasible, but a quick check at my game shows monsters with 234, 77, 59, and 52 win streaks - none of them have either Dignity or StatKing (which is basically Dignity+).

I can't say whether any of them did or didn't at some point, though, and I don't think we ever figured this Characteristic out. I think the same can be said of the Success trait.

I think this is something you should keep track of. It'd be interesting if you managed to acquire the trait again on another monster in the same way.

By Skysrpke on Friday, May 7, 2010 - 01:26 pm:

yeah i have a another psirow but he has two losses :( so idk but i will try to find out as well.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Saturday, September 4, 2010 - 01:13 am:

I've had a creature get 'Dignity' even when it had only fought the major battles. So considering that would be 'Dignity in three fights', I don't think it's purely a win streak that would do it. Or if it is, it's a random chance that may or may not get better as the monster wins.

One thing I did notice about Dignity is that I've had only a few monsters get it (either four or five). One was an Octopee. A possible one (I can't remember for sure) was a Suezo. All the rest were Golems.

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, September 4, 2010 - 04:54 pm:

Thanks, and WB!
